銅.definition: copper (chemistry); see also 紅銅|红铜[hong2 tong2]; CL:塊|块[kuai4]

銅仁.definition: see 銅仁市|铜仁市[Tong2ren2 Shi4]

銅仁市.definition: Tongren, prefecture-level city in Guizhou Province 貴州省|贵州省[Gui4zhou1 Sheng3]

銅官.definition: Tongguan, a district of Tongling City 銅陵市|铜陵市[Tong2ling2 Shi4], Anhui

銅官區.definition: Tongguan, a district of Tongling City 銅陵市|铜陵市[Tong2ling2 Shi4], Anhui

銅川.definition: see 銅川市|铜川市[Tong2chuan1 Shi4]

銅川市.definition: Tongchuan, prefecture-level city in Shaanxi Province 陝西省|陕西省[Shan3xi1 Sheng3]

銅板.definition: copper coin; copper plate; copper clappers (a kind of percussion instrument); (Tw) coin

銅梁.definition: Tongliang, a district of Chongqing 重慶|重庆[Chong2qing4]

銅梁區.definition: Tongliang, a district of Chongqing 重慶|重庆[Chong2qing4]

銅牆鐵壁.definition: copper wall, iron bastion (idiom); impenetrable defense

銅牌.definition: bronze medal; bronze plaque bearing a business name or logo etc; CL:枚[mei2]

銅翅水雉.definition: (bird species of China) bronze-winged jacana (Metopidius indicus)

銅藍鶲.definition: (bird species of China) verditer flycatcher (Eumyias thalassinus)

銅鈴.definition: bell made of copper or bronze

銅錘.definition: mace (weapon); (Chinese opera) "tongchui" (painted face role) (abbr. for 銅錘花臉|铜锤花脸[tong2chui2 hua1lian3])

銅錘花臉.definition: (Chinese opera) tongchui hualian, a military character holding a bronze mace, classified as a jing 淨|净[jing4] role

銅錢.definition: copper coin (round with a square hole in the middle, used in former times in China)

銅鑼鄉.definition: Tongluo or Tunglo township in Miaoli county 苗栗縣|苗栗县[Miao2 li4 xian4], northwest Taiwan

銅陵.definition: see 銅陵市|铜陵市[Tong2ling2 Shi4]

銅陵市.definition: Tongling, prefecture-level city in Anhui Province 安徽省[An1hui1 Sheng3]

銅鼓縣.definition: Tonggu county in Yichun 宜春, Jiangxi
